HTML5 / W3C : update doctype to HTML5 (continuation of #1202 PR #1206) for some others documents
HTML5 / W3C : span need closing
HTML5 / W3C : td can't have a width param.
Default browsers behavior give a similar render
HTML5 / W3C : "[" and "]" aren't valid characters in url.
As toolbox->append_params are intended to "query string to be happened to a URL", convert theses caracters to their urlencode() value
HTML5 / W3C : Attribute value not allowed on element input when type is image
HTML5 / W3C : The name attribute on the img element is obsolete. + unused on this case
HTML5 / W3C : attribute size can only be set when type is text, search, url, tel, email, or password

Adds smtp max retries mechanism (#1880)

Adds smtp max retries mechanism

If the sent_try count for a message exceeds the smtp_max_retries
threshold, the event is logged to file and marked for deletion so that
no more delivery attempts are made.

Further, if the smtp_max_retries config is set, GLPI will begin logging
a warning when an SMTP delivery fails.

add missing MSIN field to simcards (#2930)

* Add missing MSIN field to simcards

MSIN is the last 8 or 10 digits of IMSI
IMSI is the combination of:
- MCC (Mobile Country Code) (3 digits)
- MNC (Mobile Network Code) (2 or 3 digits)
- MSIN (Mobile Subscriber Identification Number) (8 or 10 digits)

Having 3 digits length MCC and 3 digits length MNC and 10 digits length MSIN is not allowed
because the full length is at most 15 digits.

Possible combinations are:
3 digits MCC + 2 digits MNC + 10 igits MSIN = 15 digits
3 digits MCC + 3 ditigs MNC + 8 digits MSIN = 14 digits
3 digits MCC + 2 digits MNC + 8 digits MSIN = 13 digits

MCC and MNC are stored in the line operator itemtype
MSIN is stored in a items_simcards itemtype. To save the full IMSI, one must
create a simcard component, instanciate it, fill its MSIN field and associate it to a line operator
with MCC and MNC fields populated.
